living the cosmology of the Land
Centre for Mathematics, Science and Technology Education
Centre for Mathematics, Science and Technology Education

The educational system in Alberta (and across Canada) has been called to integrate Indigenous knowledges and teaching approaches in their classroom by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Many Alberta teachers have shown interest and willingness to participate and become allies with Indigenous Peoples to achieve this goal. However
in our experience as an educational research and outreach centre
they feel they lack the ability to do this due to inexperience with pedagogical methods

the process of decolonization in general and the unique holistic environmental approaches of Indigenous Peoples. In partnership with a locally-based Indigenous Knowledge-keeper CMASTE has offered a year long Land- based Learning experience for kindergarten to grade 12 science teachers. The purpose of this study is to assess how Land-based Learning could be used as an effective teacher professional development model with a sample of science teachers in Alberta.
